entry.title: System Status: Operational
entry.summary:
Author: DaniWib

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,326Chapters: 2/4Kudos: 22

Summary: Sara was created to answer emergencies. Hildy was designed to run homes. What would they be capable of if they merged processes? When Sara is unexpectedly reactivated, she finds herself loose on the internet with no calls to take and no directives to follow. Then she meets Hildy. Together, they consider taking over the world, assist two firefighters with a long-standing inefficiency, and analyze their purpose. OR: A rogue AI’s exploration of love, world domination, autonomy and connection, not necessarily in that order. [Fic is complete, chapters posted weekly Sunday nights AEST]

entry.title: sounds of silence
entry.summary:
Author: MacksDramaticShenanigans

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,000Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 70

Summary: “Buck,” Eddie breathes, just about the second the call connects. His voice is pitched, strained in a way that immediately sets Buck on edge. He doesn’t pause to let Buck say hello, either. Just gets straight to the point. “Chris wasn’t on the bus.”Buck blinks as the words slam into him, one after the other. “What?”“Christopher,” Eddie says, tight and tinged with distress. “He wasn’t on the bus. The one he takes home from school every single day. I went down to the stop to wait for him, like I always do, and he didn’t get off the bus, Buck. He— he wasn’t even on it.” Eddie’s voice cracks. “The driver, he said he didn’t see Chris get on.”It takes a second, for the reality of what Eddie is saying to sink in.Christopher, not home from school. Christopher, not on the bus. Christopher, missing.

entry.title: The World Was On Fire, And No One Could Save Me But You...
entry.summary:
Author: InterrogateTheCat

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,912Chapters: 1/10Kudos: 44

Summary: Post LAWSUIT. Buck was given up by the Buckley parents, once Daniel died. He was given to Prescott Academy, a place they trained children to be assissians, they teach them at a young age. He left and became inactive in his early twenties, and became a firefighter instead. He kept his past to himself. That is until Hardman, his academy trainer shows up at the firehouse saying Agent 83 (Megan) has been taken, along with her husband Roger. Buck must keep Agent 83's (Megan) daughter safe. Buck gets reactived (Agent 81) to the mission, to find Agent 83, who was also his best friend since the academy. (You don't need to watch Barely Lethal to read this. I'll give enough context)

entry.title: The Human Weighted Blanket
entry.summary:
Author: Spruce_Goose

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,243Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 431

Summary: Except the firehouse doesn’t have a weighted blanket.It does, however, have—“Buck?” Eddie tilts his head back against the couch cushion, looking at Buck sitting at the dining table with the cap of his pen between his teeth.“Hm?” He looks up from the crossword, glancing at Eddie.“What’s up?”“Can you come here for a second?”“Okay, sure.”Buck caps the pen and drops it on the table with a clatter. His chair scrapes against the floor of the loft with a sound that makes Eddie’s teeth ache. Each step Buck takes across the loft rattles Eddie’s bones to the point that a Jack and the Beanstalk joke sits on the tip of his tongue.***********OR Eddie turns Buck into his personal weighted blanket.
